question.title: Why is VSCode ignoring the properties file I declared using Java/Spring?
question.body:
I have the following in a application-personal.yaml

app:
  auth:
    domain: myaccount.auth0.com
    clientId: ${AUTH0_CLIENT_ID}
    scope: openid profile email add:documents site:admin

This file is ignored in my .gitignore, but when I run via ZShell (on a macbook) everything works. However with the following in my VSCode launch.json

{
    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible attributes.
    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "java",
            "name": "ArtificialUnIntelligenceApplication",
            "request": "launch",
            "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}",
            "console": "internalConsole",
            "mainClass": "doo.dah.aui.artificial_unintelligence.ArtificialUnIntelligenceApplication",
            "projectName": "app",
            "env": {
                "SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE": "${env:SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE}",
                "OPENAI_API_KEY": "${env:OPENAI_API_KEY}",
                "PINECONE_API_KEY": "${env:PINECONE_API_KEY}",
                "SPRING_AI_OPENAI_API_KEY": "${env:SPRING_AI_OPENAI_API_KEY}",
                "AUTH0_CLIENT_ID": "${env:AUTH0_CLIENT_ID}"
            }
        },
    ]
}

When I run it acts like it is missing the properties in the file:

***************************
APPLICATION FAILED TO START
***************************

Description:

Failed to bind properties under 'app.auth' to doo.dah.aui.artificial_unintelligence.config.auth.AuthProperties:

    Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to create instance for doo.dah.aui.artificial_unintelligence.config.auth.AuthProperties

This may be due to missing parameter name information

Again this works fine by just running gradle bootrun on the same box, so why is VSCode having trouble? How do I fix it?

question_comments.body: Updated to make that even more clear

@queeg not always true see my link or provide one defining it as such. Also nothing in my post calls them "Java Properties" As my posts show they are part of the spring setup I just mention I am using them with Java.
@Jackie In Java properties are line based or XML. You are referencing Spring.
@queeg in Java proeprties can be yaml or .properties see docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/1.1.0.M1/reference/html/… docs.spring.io/spring-boot/reference/features/…
I know this is not an answer, but any reason you aren't using IDEA?
You mention java and properties file - then present a .yaml. This is confusing. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.properties

The environment variables SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE etc. need to be set and exported when you launch VS Code. Close VS Code, export the variables, launch code from the same terminal window with code . (for example) and the problem should be resolved. If that doesn't help, can you make your question more of a minimal reproducible example?
